subject: Use futures to make parts of the memcached driver async
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-20 06:25:35.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'tooz/drivers/memcached.py'], 'message': 'Use futures to make parts of the memcached driver async

Instead of having a sync api exposing async results in a
synchronous manner we can provide a asynchronous api by
just using a simple executor and using the futures that it
returns to map into the tooz async result concept.

This moves the simplistic methods that are not using the
retry decorator to being actually async, in a future change
the retry decorated ones can be altered as well...

Change-Id: I39d86da24b3f559890df12095ebde837e2820c63
'}]
commit_message:
Use futures to make parts of the memcached driver async

Instead of having a sync api exposing async results in a
synchronous manner we can provide a asynchronous api by
just using a simple executor and using the futures that it
returns to map into the tooz async result concept.

This moves the simplistic methods that are not using the
retry decorator to being actually async, in a future change
the retry decorated ones can be altered as well...

Change-Id: I39d86da24b3f559890df12095ebde837e2820c63

commit_message:
Deprecate unused entries in cfg.py

backup_namespace and restore_namespace are now referenced on a
per-datastore basis. Having them in the common options is now no
longer useful. Deleted them from the common_options and marked them as
deprecated in the datastores.

Change-Id: I2d021d68c483b77f9426d78685a06fb0733ec5e9
Closes-Bug: #1351545

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2759, 'name': 'Huang Zhiteng', 'email': 'winston.d@gmail.com', 'username': 'zhiteng-huang'}, {'_account_id': 4355, 'name': 'Avishay Traeger', 'email': 'avishay@stratoscale.com', 'username': 'avishay-il'}, {'_account_id': 6491, 'name': 'xing-yang', 'email': 'xingyang105@gmail.com', 'username': 'xing-yang'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10503, 'name': 'Huawei ML2 CI', 'email': 'huawei-openstack-ci@huawei.com', 'username': 'huawei-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11047, 'name': 'Mark Sturdevant', 'email': 'mark.sturdevant@ibm.com', 'username': 'markstur'}, {'_account_id': 12369, 'name': 'Pure Storage CI', 'username': 'purestorage-cinder-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12778, 'name': 'HDS HNAS CI', 'email': 'OpenStackDevelopment@hds.com', 'username': 'hds-hnas-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-09-23 05:02:54.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/scheduler/test_capacity_weigher.py', 'cinder/scheduler/weights/capacity.py', 'cinder/tests/scheduler/fakes.py'], 'message': "Downgrade 'infinite' and 'unknown' capacity in weigher

When FilterScheduler was first introduced into Cinder, drivers were
required for the first time to report capacity. Some drivers preferred
to report 'infinite' or 'unknown' capacity because they were doing
thin-provisioning or the total capacity kept increasing. Now that we
have better support for thin-provisioning and we do find unrealistic
capacity couldn't do us any good in making optimal scheduling decision,
because 'infinite' and 'unknown' would always have the highest weight
when the weight multiplier is positive, which in most cases it is.

Drivers are expected to avoid sending 'infinite' 'unknown' capacity
anymore, instead, should report an actual real number for total/free
capacity.

This fix doesn't fix the driver, instead a small tweak is added to
CapacityWeigher in order to downgrade those drivers who report
'infinite' or 'unknown' as free capacity.  In particular, those who
report 'infinite'/'unknown' free capacity will be adjusted to be the
one has lowest weight, no matter in 'spreading' (weight multiplier>0)
or 'stacking' (weight multiplier<0) mode.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ied087386a1a2f43e6a77499a817d5c637ef448f6
Partial-bug: #1350638
"}]
commit_message:
Downgrade 'infinite' and 'unknown' capacity in weigher

When FilterScheduler was first introduced into Cinder, drivers were
required for the first time to report capacity. Some drivers preferred
to report 'infinite' or 'unknown' capacity because they were doing
thin-provisioning or the total capacity kept increasing. Now that we
have better support for thin-provisioning and we do find unrealistic
capacity couldn't do us any good in making optimal scheduling decision,
because 'infinite' and 'unknown' would always have the highest weight
when the weight multiplier is positive, which in most cases it is.

Drivers are expected to avoid sending 'infinite' 'unknown' capacity
anymore, instead, should report an actual real number for total/free
capacity.

This fix doesn't fix the driver, instead a small tweak is added to
CapacityWeigher in order to downgrade those drivers who report
'infinite' or 'unknown' as free capacity.  In particular, those who
report 'infinite'/'unknown' free capacity will be adjusted to be the
one has lowest weight, no matter in 'spreading' (weight multiplier>0)
or 'stacking' (weight multiplier<0) mode.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ied087386a1a2f43e6a77499a817d5c637ef448f6
Partial-bug: #1350638

[{'number': 8, 'created': '2014-09-23 19:38:12.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Sync network_info if instance not found before _build_resources yield

If instance is deleted before _build_resources yield, there won't
waiting for network_info sync finish.

So there is race case, when the exception catching for
'InstanceNotFound' in do_build_and_run_instance invoke
'_cleanup_allocated_networks', the '_allocate_network_async' didn't
create port yet. After '_cleanup_allocated_networks' finished,
'_allocate_network_async' create new port for the instance, but there
isn't any cleanup for the new port anymore.

Change-Id: I5027a1aaeb9a2106f7982fd0422f88c4caa20ffb
Related-Bug: #1357055
"}]
commit_message:
Sync network_info if instance not found before _build_resources yield

If instance is deleted before _build_resources yield, there won't
waiting for network_info sync finish.

So there is race case, when the exception catching for
'InstanceNotFound' in do_build_and_run_instance invoke
'_cleanup_allocated_networks', the '_allocate_network_async' didn't
create port yet. After '_cleanup_allocated_networks' finished,
'_allocate_network_async' create new port for the instance, but there
isn't any cleanup for the new port anymore.

Change-Id: I5027a1aaeb9a2106f7982fd0422f88c4caa20ffb
Related-Bug: #1357055

commit_message:
Update settings.py to resolve UncompressableFileError

The latest Horizon master requires xstatic.pkg.bootstrap_datepicker
library and an updated settings.py that imports it correctly,
otherwise there will be a fatal UncompressableFileError.
We need to reflect the latest horizon settings.py in dashboard

Change-Id: I3cd4b2a62b9df534ca55df4f4554b53d94f304cb
Closes-Bug: 1373048

commit_message:
Added fix for dependacy for mysql-chef_gem

Bumped the version to 0.0.4 that has a fix for ubuntu ruby191-dev.
The error this resolves is this:
```ruby
        /usr/bin/ruby1.9.1 extconf.rb
/usr/lib/ruby/1.9.1/rubygems/custom_require.rb:36:in `require': cannot load such file -- mkmf (LoadError)
        from /usr/lib/ruby/1.9.1/rubygems/custom_require.rb:36:in `require'
        from extconf.rb:5:in `<main>'
```

Change-Id: I22dd7ce70088b6b4551f249e308faaab28a50e31

This test suite should be removed for the following reasons.

1) it's not a unit test

2) it's failing randomly, a lot, and depends on timing of the host for
process start and signal handling which are provably not predicable on
slower machines

3) it's triggering testr bugs in the ways that it fails which means we
don't actually get any subunit in the fail scenario, which makes it
actually impossible to move forward on fixes.

Change-Id: Ieb7c02115c12cd9f6c9fa67691a643aed7632784
Closes-Bug: #1357578
"}]
commit_message:
remove test_multiprocess_api

This test suite should be removed for the following reasons.

1) it's not a unit test

2) it's failing randomly, a lot, and depends on timing of the host for
process start and signal handling which are provably not predicable on
slower machines

3) it's triggering testr bugs in the ways that it fails which means we
don't actually get any subunit in the fail scenario, which makes it
actually impossible to move forward on fixes.

Change-Id: Ieb7c02115c12cd9f6c9fa67691a643aed7632784
Closes-Bug: #1357578

subject: Set tripleo ci control variables based on job name
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-17 11:32:10.000000000', 'files': ['toci_gate_test.sh'], 'message': "Set tripleo ci control variables based on job name

Currently if we change any of these variables we wont know if we did the
right thing until is merged into openstack-infra/config. Moving these
into tripleo-ci will give us the ability to make changes and have CI
validate we did the correct thing. It will also ensure all jobs run with
the same defaults (e.g. currently not all the jobs run with
USE_CIRROS=1 which I don't think was ever intended).

Finally we will soon be turning back on hp1 which has a different test
network IP range, so we will need the ability to set the IPs of the
proxy and geard server based on rack, which can be done here not in
openstack-infra/config.

Change-Id: I565bb10442ce4eb73fc91397d22dd1fce25cd35b
"}]
commit_message:
Set tripleo ci control variables based on job name

Currently if we change any of these variables we wont know if we did the
right thing until is merged into openstack-infra/config. Moving these
into tripleo-ci will give us the ability to make changes and have CI
validate we did the correct thing. It will also ensure all jobs run with
the same defaults (e.g. currently not all the jobs run with
USE_CIRROS=1 which I don't think was ever intended).

Finally we will soon be turning back on hp1 which has a different test
network IP range, so we will need the ability to set the IPs of the
proxy and geard server based on rack, which can be done here not in
openstack-infra/config.

Change-Id: I565bb10442ce4eb73fc91397d22dd1fce25cd35b

subject: Fix auth_token for old oslo.config
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-22 23:23:38.000000000', 'files': ['keystonemiddleware/auth_token.py'], 'message': "Fix auth_token for old oslo.config

When running with a havana-level of oslo.config (<1.3.0),
applications with any config options in their api-paste.ini will
fail to start with an error like

 'StrOpt' object has no attribute 'type'

This is because the config options didn't have a type attribute
until 1.3.0.

During the grenade test, the havana level of oslo.config is used.

Change-Id: I745c3e04f18941a2d41e191d43f61b926522bb9d
Closes-Bug: #1372422
"}]
commit_message:
Fix auth_token for old oslo.config

When running with a havana-level of oslo.config (<1.3.0),
applications with any config options in their api-paste.ini will
fail to start with an error like

 'StrOpt' object has no attribute 'type'

This is because the config options didn't have a type attribute
until 1.3.0.

During the grenade test, the havana level of oslo.config is used.

Change-Id: I745c3e04f18941a2d41e191d43f61b926522bb9d
Closes-Bug: #1372422

[{'number': 15, 'created': '2014-09-22 10:41:24.000000000', 'files': ['keystonemiddleware/auth_token.py', 'keystonemiddleware/tests/test_auth_token_middleware.py', 'keystonemiddleware/tests/client_fixtures.py'], 'message': "Add composite authentication support

Add support for composite authentication using a new 'service token'
in addition to the existing 'user token'.

If no service token is present there is no change in current behaviour.

If a service token is present and successfully validated then additional
wsgi environment variables are set which services may use to allow or
deny actions in conjunction with the existing environment variables.

For now delayed authentication is not supported for service tokens;
if a service token is present but invalid then HTTP Unauthorized (401)
will be returned.

Change-Id: Idb97c075a59d716af8bc56875785b825625bf0c9
Implements: bp service-tokens
"}]
commit_message:
Add composite authentication support

Add support for composite authentication using a new 'service token'
in addition to the existing 'user token'.

If no service token is present there is no change in current behaviour.

If a service token is present and successfully validated then additional
wsgi environment variables are set which services may use to allow or
deny actions in conjunction with the existing environment variables.

For now delayed authentication is not supported for service tokens;
if a service token is present but invalid then HTTP Unauthorized (401)
will be returned.

Change-Id: Idb97c075a59d716af8bc56875785b825625bf0c9
Implements: bp service-tokens

subject: Fix test failure after discovery hack
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-09-21 22:49:43.000000000', 'files': ['keystonemiddleware/tests/test_auth_token_middleware.py', 'keystonemiddleware/tests/client_fixtures.py'], 'message': "Fix test failure after discovery hack

With the discovery hack, the test_auth_plugin is now trying to
query the unversioned endpoint from the catalog to discover what
versions it supports. Since that URL wasn't stubbed out with
httpretty it was causing a failure and then a different URL than
expected was returned by the plugin.

This change registers the discovery URL that's in the test token
so that fetching it doesn't fail but returns a normal version
response.

Related-Bug: #1335726
Closes-Bug: #1372190
Change-Id: I1ae41801ed44ec6a37d972f62fc853dfd609128f
"}]
commit_message:
Fix test failure after discovery hack

With the discovery hack, the test_auth_plugin is now trying to
query the unversioned endpoint from the catalog to discover what
versions it supports. Since that URL wasn't stubbed out with
httpretty it was causing a failure and then a different URL than
expected was returned by the plugin.

This change registers the discovery URL that's in the test token
so that fetching it doesn't fail but returns a normal version
response.

Related-Bug: #1335726
Closes-Bug: #1372190
Change-Id: I1ae41801ed44ec6a37d972f62fc853dfd609128f

commit_message:
Cleanup leftover wizard data in session on adding App to Env

Default horizon setting is to use cookie-based session storage, which
has a limit of 4096 bytes (actually, a bit less), thus it can be
overflown very quickly in case one user adds many applications.

Closes-Bug: #1372963
Change-Id: Icf5a908fa330c6a80f80c31bc59331735e3a86d4

commit_message:
Initial kerberos plugin implementation.

This patch will enable kerberos when doing authentication.
It will reuse any existing kerberos token and use it if the
server uses WWW-Authenticate: Negotiate. It adds an extra
dependency to requests-kerberos to allow this functionality.

bp: kerberos-auth-plugin

Change-Id: Idf02bf27b5933c00827dd08d11ac131896184ad8

subject: Remove restrictive hard-coded orders validation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-18 22:21:37.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/common/validators.py', 'barbican/tests/common/test_validators.py', 'barbican/tests/api/test_resources.py'], 'message': "Remove restrictive hard-coded orders validation

The orders validation process for generating new secrets was enforcing
that parameters such as 'algorithm' were set to specific values, such
as 'aes'. This logic was put in place when only AES-generation was
provided by the default HSM plugin, as it is better to return a
synchronous error to clients than to wait until asynchronous
processing occurs. Now that 3rd party plugins are available that can
provide other generation types, this restriction is no longer valid.
So for Juno, the decision was to relax this validation logic, and to
let asynchronous processing by plugins flag any errors. In Kilo
however, the plan is to let the plugins perform this validation
up-front. TODO comments have been added to this effect.

Change-Id: I4e57c365ead698bf5435f0a5ca7be8076dfddb6a
"}]
commit_message:
Remove restrictive hard-coded orders validation

The orders validation process for generating new secrets was enforcing
that parameters such as 'algorithm' were set to specific values, such
as 'aes'. This logic was put in place when only AES-generation was
provided by the default HSM plugin, as it is better to return a
synchronous error to clients than to wait until asynchronous
processing occurs. Now that 3rd party plugins are available that can
provide other generation types, this restriction is no longer valid.
So for Juno, the decision was to relax this validation logic, and to
let asynchronous processing by plugins flag any errors. In Kilo
however, the plan is to let the plugins perform this validation
up-front. TODO comments have been added to this effect.

Change-Id: I4e57c365ead698bf5435f0a5ca7be8076dfddb6a

commit_message:
Added fix for dependacy for mysql-chef_gem

Bumped the version to 0.0.4 that has a fix for ubuntu ruby191-dev.
The error this resolves is this:
```ruby
        /usr/bin/ruby1.9.1 extconf.rb
/usr/lib/ruby/1.9.1/rubygems/custom_require.rb:36:in `require': cannot load such file -- mkmf (LoadError)
        from /usr/lib/ruby/1.9.1/rubygems/custom_require.rb:36:in `require'
        from extconf.rb:5:in `<main>'
```

Change-Id: I4962b623556f28e4b4554b36ed3299e3d1fc4b5f

commit_message:
Supply missing cisco_cfg_agent.ini file

cisco_cfg_agent.ini file was missed in the initial commit and
caused neutron startup issues. This patch supplies the proper
ini file and adds it back to neutron setup.cfg.
Also the introduced config options are put in a specific group
instead of default as was in the initial commit.

Change-Id: I74b3b77fe6e196524809580f522f91f3b62f5ba7
Closes-bug: #1351466

commit_message:
convert multiprocess tests to addCleanup

Don't use tearDown as that will break the tearDown path on the test
framework should it error. Using addCleanup is considered better
form. Clean up towards trying to fix the multiprocess bug.

Change-Id: Icc242521cb73ddb0c7f98bee8a432a38f955c07e
Related-Bug: #1357578

This patch adds support for working with multiple glusterfs volumes
for the GlusterFS native protocol driver. Since the semantics and
mapping for native driver is different compared to GlusterFS NFS

commit_message:
Add support for working with multiple glusterfs volumes

This patch adds support for working with multiple glusterfs volumes
for the GlusterFS native protocol driver. Since the semantics and
mapping for native driver is different compared to GlusterFS NFS
driver, this patch refactors the native driver as a standalone
driver and fixes some flows to fit the native driver with the
Manila share flows.

A more recent version of glusterfs having SSL support is needed.

Change-Id: I567c7602e97c9d55551baa29f121c05da2985007
Closes-Bug: #1368669

commit_message:
loading configuration parameters from trove-manage better

It is a pain to load the configuration parameters when setting up
a new environment. Since theres no way to get the uuid of the
datastore version that is created you must get it by looking in
the database.

Change-Id: I24e747abd82729ea9623ce567370681854eb8c67
Closes-Bug: #1371297

subject: always check servers are active before rescuing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-11 14:40:19.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/servers/test_server_rescue.py'], 'message': "always check servers are active before rescuing

We assume that when we start a test the server is active, however
there isn't really a reason to assume that. We're using a set of
shared servers, so there might be a bad transition left at the end of
a previous test.

Be more explicit to check for active server before we run any rescue
commands.

Change-Id: Idfcdaf8cde044fa2fd751af002ecb701371e7c3f
Closes-Bug: #1361781
"}]
commit_message:
always check servers are active before rescuing

We assume that when we start a test the server is active, however
there isn't really a reason to assume that. We're using a set of
shared servers, so there might be a bad transition left at the end of
a previous test.

Be more explicit to check for active server before we run any rescue
commands.

Change-Id: Idfcdaf8cde044fa2fd751af002ecb701371e7c3f
Closes-Bug: #1361781

subject: Skip tagging if tag exists
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-18 14:51:29.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_release.sh'], 'message': 'Skip tagging if tag exists

If the repository for the project already has a tag with the given name,
ask the user whether they want to continue or not.

This change also includes a drive-by fix for the case where the
launchpad project specified on the command line does not match the
repository name (as with python-stevedore and python-cliff).

Change-Id: I668bd7d57c7406c9ace2467f468fe49fc7cb8b29
'}]
commit_message:
Skip tagging if tag exists

If the repository for the project already has a tag with the given name,
ask the user whether they want to continue or not.

This change also includes a drive-by fix for the case where the
launchpad project specified on the command line does not match the
repository name (as with python-stevedore and python-cliff).

Change-Id: I668bd7d57c7406c9ace2467f468fe49fc7cb8b29

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-08-06 14:25:30.000000000', 'files': ['fuelweb_test/models/environment.py', 'fuelweb_test/tests/base_test_case.py'], 'message': "Skip time sync on nodes while env is preparing

Add possibility to skip time sync after snapshot
reverted.  Also, we don't need to sync time on
bootstrapped nodes every time when snapshot is
reverted (usualy about 3 times per test) because
each test reverts it's own snapshot and still do
time sync.
This may speed up each run of tests by 5-15 min.

Change-Id: Ib3cc4023212018548952bc172f292769620c522e
"}]
commit_message:
Skip time sync on nodes while env is preparing

Add possibility to skip time sync after snapshot
reverted.  Also, we don't need to sync time on
bootstrapped nodes every time when snapshot is
reverted (usualy about 3 times per test) because
each test reverts it's own snapshot and still do
time sync.
This may speed up each run of tests by 5-15 min.

Change-Id: Ib3cc4023212018548952bc172f292769620c522e

commit_message:
reissue SIGTERM when reaping

In case the SIGTERM got lost earlier, reissue the SIGTERM as we're
polling for workers to shut down. Possibly helps in child processes
not going away and hanging the tests.

Change-Id: I10b244bd932445687042a1ce691e51f3927ab734
Related-Bug: #1357578

commit_message:
Switch oslo-incubator to use oslo.utils and remove old modules

keystone client/middleware, nova all have tests that mock
utcnow when we introduce oslo.utils into those projects, we have
test failures because of references to copies of timeutils/utcnow
in for example memorycache. So the best way to deal with it is to
ensure that all code in oslo-incubator refer to oslo.utils. Added a
note in the deprecated code so when folks sync, they will be aware
of it.

Per the new process, we will not be keeping graduated files around
on the master branch of incubator.

Closes-Bug: #1354521
Closes-Bug: #1371713
Change-Id: If80e66c7dae1bfcda8e884c57b7086f34d026040

hardware.get_vcpu_pin_set will give us back a list, but there are couple

(_get_guest_numa_config and _get_host_numa_topology). Make sure those

commit_message:
libvirt: convert ret val of get_vcpu_pin_set to a set()

hardware.get_vcpu_pin_set will give us back a list, but there are couple
of places where it is much more beneficial to use it as a set()
(_get_guest_numa_config and _get_host_numa_topology). Make sure those
methods convert it to a set() before using it in set operations.

Change-Id: I955c12f794554fa183b019ac936f4c763ec67b5b
Closes-bug: #1372829

commit_message:
Changes for Sahara and Murano OSTF tests

We should allow running Sahara tests only when compute node has
at least 4G RAM. That should greatly reduce number of errors. So this
limit was added to OSTF tests for Sahara.

Method for checking minimal free RAM of compute node was created and
placed in class PlatformServicesBaseClass. Now OSTF tests for Murano
use this method.

Closes-Bug: #1334700

Change-Id: Ic9333edc73c668ea5b953bb9dfa7c209fe2e258a

commit_message:
Remove Neutron DB stamp and upgrade to head

Neutron DB schema auto-generation has been removed
by this patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/40296/

We should remove DB stamp and upgrade to version "head"
each time, no matter it's first time deployment or run
by many times.

Change-Id: I74f6dc76091d6c7988b680eec16900bef3f3f61c
Closes-Bug: #1372260

After switching from uefi to bios boot mode, one system reset is
required in iLO for persistent boot device settings.pxe driver call
set_boot_device() which internally calls ipmitool to set boot device
to pxe, will fail in such scenarios.

This fix proposes to change the management interface for pxe_ilo driver
to call ilo set_boot_device using proliantutils ilo_client functions
instead of IPMI call

Closes-bug: #1370466
'}]
commit_message:
pxe_ilo driver to call iLO set_boot_device

After switching from uefi to bios boot mode, one system reset is
required in iLO for persistent boot device settings.pxe driver call
set_boot_device() which internally calls ipmitool to set boot device
to pxe, will fail in such scenarios.

This fix proposes to change the management interface for pxe_ilo driver
to call ilo set_boot_device using proliantutils ilo_client functions
instead of IPMI call

Change-Id: Idc0e3a765f447ae1d1118299e4815a06995e5414
Closes-bug: #1370466

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-09-23 10:27:14.000000000', 'files': ['meta/io.murano/Classes/resources/Instance.yaml', 'etc/murano/murano.conf.sample'], 'message': "Don't rely on OS::Nova::Server.addresses

Server.addresses's implementation in Heat is dependent on a nova extension
which is not guaranteed to be present. I'm not sure if this is something
that should be fixed in Heat or not, but this is a workaround that
results in the same information (instance.ipAddresses will be set to a
list of all IP addresses across all networks the instance is assigned
to).

Change-Id: I5154f7e2a69ab8e64f9fbd1d8a26daf07f2482cd
Closes-Bug: 1364446
"}]
commit_message:
Don't rely on OS::Nova::Server.addresses

Server.addresses's implementation in Heat is dependent on a nova extension
which is not guaranteed to be present. I'm not sure if this is something
that should be fixed in Heat or not, but this is a workaround that
results in the same information (instance.ipAddresses will be set to a
list of all IP addresses across all networks the instance is assigned
to).

Change-Id: I5154f7e2a69ab8e64f9fbd1d8a26daf07f2482cd
Closes-Bug: 1364446

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-23 14:48:19.000000000', 'files': ['labs/config/openstack', 'labs/scripts/setup_glance.sh', 'labs/scripts/apt_pre-download.sh'], 'message': 'labs: CirrOS image: check md5sum; URL in config/openstack

Copy the CirrOS image to the base disk even if the IMG_DIR is shared
with the host computer (the image in IMG_DIR remains as a cache).

Check md5sum for CirrOS image after copying it to the base disk.

CIRROS_URL is now stored in config/openstack to allow CirrOS version
upates in one location.

Change-Id: If0cf35d3806e3478875c5cceeaceca683fe1a58e
'}]
commit_message:
labs: CirrOS image: check md5sum; URL in config/openstack

Copy the CirrOS image to the base disk even if the IMG_DIR is shared
with the host computer (the image in IMG_DIR remains as a cache).

Check md5sum for CirrOS image after copying it to the base disk.

CIRROS_URL is now stored in config/openstack to allow CirrOS version
upates in one location.

Change-Id: If0cf35d3806e3478875c5cceeaceca683fe1a58e

commit_message:
Improve ODL ML2 Exception Handling

Raise a MechanismDriverError when authentication with ODL fails.
Re-raise HTTPError in "sync_resources" for exceptions whose status code is not 404.

Closes-Bug: #1311758
Change-Id: I99d2c4f270007c369024525ba4e6188d232a0b13
(cherry picked from commit 7db44edd3c5ad4aea508c3cc74a8b0b8d785c26b)

commit_message:
Remove redundant context parameter

The methods _do_node_deploy() and _do_node_tear_down() is receiving the
context as a parameter but that's not used, and, as the methods already
receive task as another parameter the context is redudant because the
task object already have the context within it.

Change-Id: Ifdeb6e394d53e0a827af6eed36067ca402ba6054
Closes-Bug: #1372870

subject: VMware: Improve cleanup on cache directory move failure
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9555, 'name': 'Matthew Booth', 'email': 'mbooth@redhat.com', 'username': 'MatthewBooth'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-16 15:30:52.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py', 'nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_vmops.py'], 'message': "VMware: Improve cleanup on cache directory move failure

We currently unconditionally attempt to delete the temporary cache
directory, even after we've successfully moved it, and therefore know
it no longer exists.

This change moves the cleanup into the error path of the directory
move, so that we only attempt to delete the temporary directory if it
needs to be deleted. This results in 1 less vSphere call when caching
a new image during spawn.

Change-Id: I29b5284f7cc3ab7dbe212dd50ceb786f12b8b628
"}]
commit_message:
VMware: Improve cleanup on cache directory move failure

We currently unconditionally attempt to delete the temporary cache
directory, even after we've successfully moved it, and therefore know
it no longer exists.

This change moves the cleanup into the error path of the directory
move, so that we only attempt to delete the temporary directory if it
needs to be deleted. This results in 1 less vSphere call when caching
a new image during spawn.

Change-Id: I29b5284f7cc3ab7dbe212dd50ceb786f12b8b628

import multiple items on the same line for gettextutils.

commit_message:
Enumerate Projects with Unscoped Tokens

Creating a client with a session using an Unscoped tokens now sets auth
info in client.  This Auth Info is necessary in order to enumerate
projects.  This is the standard login path for Horizon.

Change-Id: I688a27cd0e7c98e7cf899ac65bb593a85171813f

subject: Fix master status validation while replica provisioning
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-09-23 11:19:54.000000000', 'files': ['trove/instance/models.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/instance/test_instance_models.py'], 'message': "Fix master status validation while replica provisioning

Use case: Master instance is not ACTIVE.
In this case we need to check if master is
ACTIVE and raise HTTP 422 UnprocessableEntity in cases when status
is something else than ACTIVE (BUILD, ERROR, BACKUP, FAILED, RESIZE, etc.).

Reasons:
 - Slave can be created from master that's not in ACTIVE state.

Changes:
 - adding master status validation step;
 - unit test added

Change-Id: I191549678bd397af6fadae4679c3d5291cd535b1
Closes-Bug: #1357705
"}]
commit_message:
Fix master status validation while replica provisioning

Use case: Master instance is not ACTIVE.
In this case we need to check if master is
ACTIVE and raise HTTP 422 UnprocessableEntity in cases when status
is something else than ACTIVE (BUILD, ERROR, BACKUP, FAILED, RESIZE, etc.).

Reasons:
 - Slave can be created from master that's not in ACTIVE state.

Changes:
 - adding master status validation step;
 - unit test added

commit_message:
Revert "libvirt: Uses correct imagebackend for configdrive"

This reverts commit 0b01e846d40f3b343da9ebe1dae89cca8bc2ac66.

We  should not be adding instance specific disks with configuration
information like passwords into a shared cache. I think this is the
wrong way of moving the config drive disk image into an arbitrary
backend store.

Change-Id: I1376ef5f3fcbd66d916ff9442efea0f756dd42da

commit_message:
Fixed missing Launch as Instance for snapshot

The snapshot created from a bootable volume doesn't have 'Launch
as Instance' action item show up.

Fixed the issue, now the snapshot created from a bootable volume
should have the 'Launch as Instance' action item.

Note: for how to create a bootable volume, please check the bug
detail.

Closes-Bug: #1369189

Change-Id: I2a085c6fc07a4b08b1cb0fc61ad82a1dfa14af65

commit_message:
Remove the AUDIT log message about loaded ext

Finally, I got to a boiling point when having to scroll through endless
and pointless log.AUDIT messages about "Loading extension XXX" in the
startup messages for the os-api endpoints. This patch gets rid of this
extreme annoyance.

Change-Id: Ia47f6afae89d145ade2a940d4720f5977fde2204

Add code to fake which allows tests to optionally require a parent

commit_message:
VMware: Check parent dir in fake during create/copy disk

Add code to fake which allows tests to optionally require a parent
directory to exist when creating or moving a disk. A real server
always requires this, but we don't enable it by default as it may not
be relevant to all tests.

Change-Id: I4e6a04289d2f18950cc9a4c2c82820dc81428b2b

subject: pxe_ilo driver to call iLO set_boot_device
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-24 08:45:27.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/ilo/deploy.py', 'ironic/tests/drivers/ilo/test_deploy.py', 'ironic/drivers/pxe.py'], 'message': 'pxe_ilo driver to call iLO set_boot_device

    After switching from uefi to bios boot mode, one system reset is
    required in iLO for persistent boot device settings.pxe driver call
    set_boot_device() which internally calls ipmitool to set boot device
    to pxe, will fail in such scenarios.

    This fix proposes to change the management interface for pxe_ilo driver
    to call ilo set_boot_device using proliantutils ilo_client functions
    instead of IPMI call

    Change-Id: Idc0e3a765f447ae1d1118299e4815a06995e5414
    Closes-bug: #1370466

Change-Id: Ifd043d34741b894e217e851e9e8b765fbdfac24a
'}]
commit_message:
pxe_ilo driver to call iLO set_boot_device

    After switching from uefi to bios boot mode, one system reset is
    required in iLO for persistent boot device settings.pxe driver call
    set_boot_device() which internally calls ipmitool to set boot device
    to pxe, will fail in such scenarios.

    This fix proposes to change the management interface for pxe_ilo driver
    to call ilo set_boot_device using proliantutils ilo_client functions
    instead of IPMI call

    Change-Id: Idc0e3a765f447ae1d1118299e4815a06995e5414
    Closes-bug: #1370466

Change-Id: Ifd043d34741b894e217e851e9e8b765fbdfac24a

commit_message:
Update devstack docs, require Ubuntu 14.04

We no longer test deploying Devstack + Ironic on Precise 12.04 anywhere,
so we should no longer promise that it is functional there.  This removes steps
of the DevStack documentation that sets up access to the Cloud Archive and
explains that Ubuntu 14.04 is the minimum supported OS.

Closes-bug: 1371300

Change-Id: I99b7705c2c78443c7a95ff499b8c9fde33964c46

subject: Reduce resource requirements set aside for testenvs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 215, 'name': 'Jon-Paul Sullivan', 'email': 'j3p0uk@hotmail.com', 'username': 'jonpaul-sullivan'}, {'_account_id': 1926, 'name': 'Derek Higgins', 'email': 'derekh@redhat.com', 'username': 'derekh'}, {'_account_id': 4190, 'name': 'lifeless', 'email': 'robertc@robertcollins.net', 'username': 'lifeless'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios.andreou@gmail.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 9369, 'name': 'Steve Kowalik', 'email': 'steven@wedontsleep.org', 'username': 'stevenk'}, {'_account_id': 9453, 'name': 'James Polley', 'email': 'jp@jamezpolley.com', 'username': 'tchaypo'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-09-10 22:40:08.000000000', 'files': ['elements/tripleo-cd/configs/te_commonrc'], 'message': "Reduce resource requirements set aside for testenvs

CPUPerEnv : Because we're not cpu bound overcommitting slightly on CPU
should not cause us any problems.

MemPerEnv : Nodes in testenvs now use the devtest default of 2G.

DiskPerEnv: Each testenv currently uses about 35G of diskspace, setting
aside almost twice should be ok.

Essentially this should cause the number of Test Envs on each hp1 host to
increase from 4 to 8 (bound by CPUPerEnv) and on each rh1 host from 3 to
6 (bound by MemPerEnv).

Change-Id: Ia39f3c395dc6cc11b5f04c591281539df8b1468f
"}]
commit_message:
Reduce resource requirements set aside for testenvs

CPUPerEnv : Because we're not cpu bound overcommitting slightly on CPU
should not cause us any problems.

MemPerEnv : Nodes in testenvs now use the devtest default of 2G.

DiskPerEnv: Each testenv currently uses about 35G of diskspace, setting
aside almost twice should be ok.

Essentially this should cause the number of Test Envs on each hp1 host to
increase from 4 to 8 (bound by CPUPerEnv) and on each rh1 host from 3 to
6 (bound by MemPerEnv).

Change-Id: Ia39f3c395dc6cc11b5f04c591281539df8b1468f

Fix adds a mixin to replace the replicated get_policy_target
function. Duplicated code is removed from many classes and mixin is
inherited.

project_id, user_id and domain_id are now default in the generated
policy_target dict but are set to None if the data doesn't support it,
this is to provide the most flexibility for operators writing policy.json
as discussed in the bug report.

policy_target_attrs attribute added by the mixin is overwrittable by
sub-classes of the mixin to override the defaults for custom policy_target
information.

Change-Id: I26759f145b8756bd1eef585c8107160277061523
Closes-Bug: 1317238
"}]
commit_message:
Add mixin to replace replicated get_policy_target

Fix adds a mixin to replace the replicated get_policy_target
function. Duplicated code is removed from many classes and mixin is
inherited.

project_id, user_id and domain_id are now default in the generated
policy_target dict but are set to None if the data doesn't support it,
this is to provide the most flexibility for operators writing policy.json
as discussed in the bug report.

policy_target_attrs attribute added by the mixin is overwrittable by
sub-classes of the mixin to override the defaults for custom policy_target
information.

Change-Id: I26759f145b8756bd1eef585c8107160277061523
Closes-Bug: 1317238

commit_message:
Update docs with new dbsync command

The ironic-dbsync utility was updated with a new 'create_schema'
command with this review:

https://review.openstack.org/107629

This updates the quickstart guide to use this new command. We also
change the deploy guide to use it, mainly for consistency of usage
in our documentation.

Closes-Bug: #1347604

Change-Id: I87b05acf61ef7424243cb040e10ab84a73a68ec3

commit_message:
Add a new blocking argument to register_all_nodes

Currently, if the nova-baremetal and ironic services are not
available when registering a node, the function calls will sleep
for ten seconds. Make this behaviour configurable by use of a
blocking flag that default to True.

Change-Id: I87b05acf61ef7424243cb040e10ab84a73a68ec3

commit_message:
Bump websockify to >=0.6.0 which fixes bug causing zombie processes

Websockify 0.6.0 has been released for more than half an year, and
it fixes bug causing zombie processes on certain systems when using
multiprocessing.

Ref: https://github.com/kanaka/websockify/issues/95

Closes-Bug: #1048703

retrieves from keystone every time

	neutron/tests/unit/test_metadata_agent.py

commit_message:
Enable to get service types from configuration file

When services are registered to keystone without using default
service types, pollsters for the services don't work. This fix
enables the pollsters to get service types from ceilometer.conf.
If there is no entry in the file, the default service types
will be used.

Change-Id: Iab30b6e749f5d2af4ecb0bbf6fe1a137793f4c2c
Closes-Bug: 1353356
DocImpact: Add new parameters in ceilometer.conf

subject: Replace wait with communicate to avoid potential deadlock
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-09-23 16:37:40.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/stress/actions/ssh_floating.py', 'tempest/tests/test_wrappers.py', 'tempest/scenario/manager.py'], 'message': 'Replace wait with communicate to avoid potential deadlock

Wait can deadlock when using stdout=PIPE and/or stderr=PIPE and the child
process generates enough output to a pipe such that it blocks waiting for
the OS pipe buffer to accept more data. Use communicate() to avoid that.

Change-Id: I452de95834a18a970ae78ab6c43d794151ce3300
closes-bug: 1372680
'}]
commit_message:
Replace wait with communicate to avoid potential deadlock

Wait can deadlock when using stdout=PIPE and/or stderr=PIPE and the child
process generates enough output to a pipe such that it blocks waiting for
the OS pipe buffer to accept more data. Use communicate() to avoid that.

Change-Id: I452de95834a18a970ae78ab6c43d794151ce3300
closes-bug: 1372680

subject: compute: manage force_raw_images parameter
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-09-22 21:31:38.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/compute.pp', 'spec/classes/nova_compute_spec.rb'], 'message': "compute: manage force_raw_images parameter

In Nova, force_raw_images allows to force backing images to raw
format.
Some use-cases require to disable this feature.

Let's use nova::compute class to manage this option, and let at True
by default as this the case in Nova (Juno release).

Change-Id: I4d700204bfd1d297667303b11e572f24dc9af2fc
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>
"}]
commit_message:
compute: manage force_raw_images parameter

In Nova, force_raw_images allows to force backing images to raw
format.
Some use-cases require to disable this feature.

Let's use nova::compute class to manage this option, and let at True
by default as this the case in Nova (Juno release).

Change-Id: I4d700204bfd1d297667303b11e572f24dc9af2fc
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>

subject: Add comparison check for 'kind' and 'match'
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-08-01 12:34:14.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/policy.py', 'tests/unit/test_policy.py'], 'message': "Add comparison check for 'kind' and 'match'

Add new ParameterEqualityCheck class in policy module to compare
the rule on the basis of 'kind' is equal to 'match'.

For example, if rule in policy.json is configured as:
'sample_rule': 'test_1234==%(test_key)s'

then test_1234 == %(test_key)s should return True if %(test_key)s has
value 'test_1234'.

blueprint: policy-compare-kind-with-match

Change-Id: Iaf01360cec8501f237ad6a017ef82caaeb6ff106
"}]
commit_message:
Add comparison check for 'kind' and 'match'

Add new ParameterEqualityCheck class in policy module to compare
the rule on the basis of 'kind' is equal to 'match'.

For example, if rule in policy.json is configured as:
'sample_rule': 'test_1234==%(test_key)s'

then test_1234 == %(test_key)s should return True if %(test_key)s has
value 'test_1234'.

blueprint: policy-compare-kind-with-match

Change-Id: Iaf01360cec8501f237ad6a017ef82caaeb6ff106

endpoint_type and 'publicURL' is the default.
It causes error when a user intends to use internal or admin URL
for communication between MetaInterfaceDriver and neutron-server.

Change-Id: Id321d5a16a08a4bda618f98bb1eb7cb1b0b9eb08
Closes-bug: #1354285

commit_message:
Add endpoint_type parameter to MetaInterfaceDriver

Previously MetaInterfaceDriver communicates with neutron-server
via 'publicURL' because it uses python-neutronclient without
endpoint_type and 'publicURL' is the default.
It causes error when a user intends to use internal or admin URL
for communication between MetaInterfaceDriver and neutron-server.

Change-Id: Id321d5a16a08a4bda618f98bb1eb7cb1b0b9eb08
Closes-bug: #1354285

subject: Fix delete error instance not automaticaly removed from table
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-02-26 13:42:06.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/test/tests/tables.py', 'horizon/tables/base.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/tables.py'], 'message': 'Fix delete error instance not automaticaly removed from table

When you terminate an instance that is in error state, Horizon
scheduled the task to terminate instance and shows "deleting.."
description on Task column but no auto-refresh occurs.. as a result,
the instance is not removed from the table after completing the deletion.
A manual page refresh is required to remove the instance from the Table.

commit_message:
Fix delete error instance not automaticaly removed from table

When you terminate an instance that is in error state, Horizon
scheduled the task to terminate instance and shows "deleting.."
description on Task column but no auto-refresh occurs.. as a result,
the instance is not removed from the table after completing the deletion.
A manual page refresh is required to remove the instance from the Table.

Change-Id: I569adb7188eab2cb6fd452fa452c2eadb0858e9d
Closes-Bug:#1274457

"cinder-manage db sync 24" failed when dropping column cgsnapshot_id
from the snapshots table.

The reason that drop column failed was because of the foreign key
constraint. MySQL cannot drop column until the foreign key constraint
is removed. So the solution is to remove the foreign key first, and

commit_message:
DB migration 25->24 failed when dropping column

"cinder-manage db sync 24" failed when dropping column cgsnapshot_id
from the snapshots table.

The reason that drop column failed was because of the foreign key
constraint. MySQL cannot drop column until the foreign key constraint
is removed. So the solution is to remove the foreign key first, and
then drop the column. This affects the cgsnapshot_id column in the
snapshots table and the consistencygroup_id column in the volumes table.

Change-Id: I89d5016be450ec91c7a7b1c42803add3f62c88df
Closes-Bug: #1368213

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-09-22 21:28:51.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/iscsi.py', 'cinder/tests/test_netapp.py'], 'message': 'Fix KeyError exception in NetApp CDOT iscsi driver volume create.

Prior to commit 98aa91b, when the NetApp CDOT iscsi driver experiences
an NaAPIError interacting with a backend vserver, it catches (and logs)
the NaAPIError, but then throws an irrelevant KeyError because the Path
metadata field has not been set properly.  The KeyError obfuscates and
buries the real error message.

In the cinder pools implementation via commit 98aa91b this problem no
longer exists, but there is a need for a fix in codebase (e.g. icehouse)
where cinder pools will not be implemented.

Note that there are multiple ways that an NaAPIError can be thrown.  In
launchpad bug 1363763 an NaAPIError was thrown, but then buried behind a
KeyError exception, because of an attempt to create a cinder volume with
a Netapp qos policy-group when the backend container on the filer
already itself had a qos policy-group attached to it (outside of
Openstack).  The fix supplied here addresses all types of NaAPIError,
not just errors related to QOS.

Change-Id: Idc93ddddefdf27b7edf0813a14d8562fb5dcd175
Closes-Bug: 1363763
'}]
commit_message:
Fix KeyError exception in NetApp CDOT iscsi driver volume create.

Prior to commit 98aa91b, when the NetApp CDOT iscsi driver experiences
an NaAPIError interacting with a backend vserver, it catches (and logs)
the NaAPIError, but then throws an irrelevant KeyError because the Path
metadata field has not been set properly.  The KeyError obfuscates and
buries the real error message.

In the cinder pools implementation via commit 98aa91b this problem no
longer exists, but there is a need for a fix in codebase (e.g. icehouse)
where cinder pools will not be implemented.

Note that there are multiple ways that an NaAPIError can be thrown.  In
launchpad bug 1363763 an NaAPIError was thrown, but then buried behind a
KeyError exception, because of an attempt to create a cinder volume with
a Netapp qos policy-group when the backend container on the filer
already itself had a qos policy-group attached to it (outside of
Openstack).  The fix supplied here addresses all types of NaAPIError,
not just errors related to QOS.

Change-Id: Idc93ddddefdf27b7edf0813a14d8562fb5dcd175
Closes-Bug: 1363763

commit_message:
Pin Pecan to 0.6.0 to fix binary secret decrypts

With the latest vesion of Pecan (0.7.0) attempts to GET binary secrets
with an Accept header of application/octet-stream result in a
Pecan/WebOb error trying to utf-8 decode the binary response.
See this link for more details:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/pecan/+bug/1373003

Change-Id: Id9469cb836cfc34636859d4cc8c0bce234e64e92
Related-Bug: #1373003

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-08-22 18:45:33.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py'], 'message': "Update block_device_info to contain swap and ephemeral disks

An ephemeral or swap disk is attached to an instance on boot
as follows: nova boot --flavor FLAVOR --image IMAGE_ID
--swap 512 --ephemeral size=2 INSTANCE.  When a hard reboot is
performed on the instance, nova fails to recreate the
appropriate libvirt XML definition, containing the ephemeral
disk.  This is because the correct block_device_info dict that
is passed to the compute manager's reboot_instance method does
not contain swap or ephemeral disk key values that are necessary
to recreate those disks.  In addition to nova boot, the correct
block_device_info dict is also needed by nova rebuild, reboot,
resize, and migrate to recreate those disks.  This patch updates
_get_instance_volume_block_device_info (renamed
_get_instance_block_device_info) to return the swap and ephemeral
disk key values, in addition to the block_device_mapping it
already returns today.

Change-Id: Iec329d1c12a48ea90ba9d57decd0996fde6544f0
Closes-Bug: #1305423
(cherry picked from commit f087a6f77ef1338bb8d10943d2a18712220c3c44)
"}]
commit_message:
Update block_device_info to contain swap and ephemeral disks

An ephemeral or swap disk is attached to an instance on boot
as follows: nova boot --flavor FLAVOR --image IMAGE_ID
--swap 512 --ephemeral size=2 INSTANCE.  When a hard reboot is
performed on the instance, nova fails to recreate the
appropriate libvirt XML definition, containing the ephemeral
disk.  This is because the correct block_device_info dict that
is passed to the compute manager's reboot_instance method does
not contain swap or ephemeral disk key values that are necessary
to recreate those disks.  In addition to nova boot, the correct
block_device_info dict is also needed by nova rebuild, reboot,
resize, and migrate to recreate those disks.  This patch updates
_get_instance_volume_block_device_info (renamed
_get_instance_block_device_info) to return the swap and ephemeral
disk key values, in addition to the block_device_mapping it
already returns today.

Change-Id: Iec329d1c12a48ea90ba9d57decd0996fde6544f0
Closes-Bug: #1305423
(cherry picked from commit f087a6f77ef1338bb8d10943d2a18712220c3c44)

commit_message:
Separate Configuration from Freescale SDN ML2 mechanism Driver

- In the current implementation, CRD configuration is existing
  within the code of ML2 mechanism driver.

- When any other plugin/driver (like, Freescale FWaaS Plugin) need
  to use this configuration, it needs to duplicate the complete configuration.

- So the CRD configuration is moved to a separate file for use
  in other plugin/drivers.

- Unit testing of this MD is also updated.

Closes-Bug: #1368033

Change-Id: I488fee47803a494aae9df42f9c59fffa9843e727

commit_message:
Duplicated image id return 409 instead of 500 in API v2

Based on current code, in API v2 duplicated image id will
return HTTP 500 error instead of 409. This patch fix this
issue and add an unit test case for that.

Closes-Bug: 1366503

Change-Id: Ia6c27f9edffd63619d63013e456072d811daf127

subject: Detect unknown option is used
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-09-21 15:35:17.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/config/cfg.py', 'tests/test_cfg.py'], 'message': 'Detect unknown option is used

Add a new method ConfigOpts.check_names(). With this method, an
application can detect that there are unregistered options in its
config file.

It is achieved in this way: first, generate a dict "{opt_name: opt}",
then iterate all parsed items to check if they are in the dict.

Change-Id: I6c87ee2ea2148f7d05c04487f1b87aa3ea972c29
'}]
commit_message:
Detect unknown option is used

Add a new method ConfigOpts.check_names(). With this method, an
application can detect that there are unregistered options in its
config file.

It is achieved in this way: first, generate a dict "{opt_name: opt}",
then iterate all parsed items to check if they are in the dict.

Change-Id: I6c87ee2ea2148f7d05c04487f1b87aa3ea972c29

commit_message:
Nova option to delete the quota for an specific resource

The quota-delete method can receive a new optional parameter with the
resource to be deleted. This operation when receives a resource, resets
the quota to the default just for this specific resource.
New extension "os-delete-quotas-by-resource" created for this change.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I645b19203956a0ae79db6581b8615fc6c123fe6f
Partial-Bug: #1064854

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-22 15:21:25.000000000', 'files': ['nova/notifications.py', 'nova/tests/test_notifications.py'], 'message': "Be less confusing about notification states

Depending on the way we snake through send_update we might end up in
_send_instance_update_notification without the vm or task states. The
issue being that we always send those states to the notification
payload. So we are actually producing notifications with None(None) =>
which is clearly not right.

This whole notification path should probably be refactored to prevent
this threading from happening, but in the mean time this will at least
mean that we aren't creating blatantly wrong notifications.

Add unit tests for the new behavior.

Change-Id: I5092880647a4ac826376396610599dab99efb08e
Closes-Bug: #1204169
"}]
commit_message:
Be less confusing about notification states

Depending on the way we snake through send_update we might end up in
_send_instance_update_notification without the vm or task states. The
issue being that we always send those states to the notification
payload. So we are actually producing notifications with None(None) =>
which is clearly not right.

This whole notification path should probably be refactored to prevent
this threading from happening, but in the mean time this will at least
mean that we aren't creating blatantly wrong notifications.

Add unit tests for the new behavior.

Change-Id: I5092880647a4ac826376396610599dab99efb08e
Closes-Bug: #1204169

subject: Stop using intersphinx
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-13 07:43:29.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/conf.py'], 'message': "Stop using intersphinx

Remove intersphinx from the docs build as it triggers network calls that
occasionally fail, and we don't really use intersphinx (links other
sphinx documents out on the internet)

This also removes the requirement for internet access during docs build.

This can cause docs jobs to fail if the project errors out on
warnings.

Change-Id: I71e941e2a639641a662a163c682eb86d51de42fb
Related-Bug: #1368910
"}]
commit_message:
Stop using intersphinx

Remove intersphinx from the docs build as it triggers network calls that
occasionally fail, and we don't really use intersphinx (links other
sphinx documents out on the internet)

This also removes the requirement for internet access during docs build.

This can cause docs jobs to fail if the project errors out on
warnings.

Change-Id: I71e941e2a639641a662a163c682eb86d51de42fb
Related-Bug: #1368910

subject: Glance API V2 can't recognize parameter 'id'
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-08 23:23:30.000000000', 'files': ['glance/api/v2/images.py', 'glance/tests/unit/v2/test_images_resource.py'], 'message': "Glance API V2 can't recognize parameter 'id'

Based on current implement, API V2 is using **id** in image schema,
but using **image_id** for most of the internal functions as key
word arguments. So user will got a key error if using:

glance --os-image-api-version 2 image-create --id <id>

This patch will map 'id' to 'image_id' in RequestDeserializer and
add an unit test case fo the change.

Closes-Bug: 1366515

Change-Id: I4c72881a7ada728307e806776426b42cf4cf0993
"}]
commit_message:
Glance API V2 can't recognize parameter 'id'

Based on current implement, API V2 is using **id** in image schema,
but using **image_id** for most of the internal functions as key
word arguments. So user will got a key error if using:

glance --os-image-api-version 2 image-create --id <id>

This patch will map 'id' to 'image_id' in RequestDeserializer and
add an unit test case fo the change.

Closes-Bug: 1366515

Change-Id: I4c72881a7ada728307e806776426b42cf4cf0993

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-23 17:56:46.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/keystone_spec.rb', 'manifests/init.pp'], 'message': "Use UUID as the default token provider

Keystone changed it's default token provider to UUID for Juno.
This patch changes the puppet-keystone default to match.

One of the existing spec tests was incorrect, and had to be removed.
The test was expecting signing certificate setup to be performed wen
enable_ssl is True, but that setup is really only performed when
configuring PKI format tokens.  There is already a test that covers
properly enabling SSL and PKI token format configuration, so this
incorrect test can be removed.

Change-Id: Id838bbb06602b9fe5331329c74872b62932ace1b
Closes-bug: #1372991
"}]
commit_message:
Use UUID as the default token provider

Keystone changed it's default token provider to UUID for Juno.
This patch changes the puppet-keystone default to match.

One of the existing spec tests was incorrect, and had to be removed.
The test was expecting signing certificate setup to be performed wen
enable_ssl is True, but that setup is really only performed when
configuring PKI format tokens.  There is already a test that covers
properly enabling SSL and PKI token format configuration, so this
incorrect test can be removed.

Change-Id: Id838bbb06602b9fe5331329c74872b62932ace1b
Closes-bug: #1372991

AngularJS syntax is evaluated twice in modal box after submitting form

commit_message:
Fixes double evaluation of AngularJS in modal box

AngularJS syntax is evaluated twice in modal box after submitting form
which succeed and no redirection is going to be made. This commit fixes
this bevahiour by executing AngularJS code just after modal is created
and not every time it is going to be shown.

Change-Id: I204fce23ce52f74c38b7dc40ef03c6d5710ad254
Closes-Bug: #1371116

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-23 05:52:13.000000000', 'files': ['etc/cinder/cinder.conf.sample', 'cinder/ssh_utils.py'], 'message': 'Fix ssh_host_key_file default in help and config.sample.conf

The commit message and the actual default say the default value for
ssh_host_key_file is $state_path/ssh_known_hosts, but the
config.conf.sample and the config opts help say it is
"$state_path/known_hosts".

commit_message:
Fix ssh_host_key_file default in help and config.sample.conf

The commit message and the actual default say the default value for
ssh_host_key_file is $state_path/ssh_known_hosts, but the
config.conf.sample and the config opts help say it is
"$state_path/known_hosts".

Fix the help and config.conf.sample to match the actual default.

Closes-Bug: 1372765
Change-Id: I51a2918155a27afcf48eda01f32774ce0d346d06

commit_message:
Test for helping root cause bug 1349617

Please do not review this patch.
Also do not be offended by a miserable attempt at skipping tests
to work around a gate bug.

The aim of this patch is to validate whether the infamous SSH
protocol banner failure really is related to these two tests or
it tends to show there and will move somewhere else once these
two tests are skipped.

Change-Id: I73b0b60627dfe4b2c417e2cf4673918b8e2692d8

commit_message:
Tie pub vip with public gw ping

Add new pacemaker cloned "ping" primitive and tie it with public
vip via "location" in order to migrate public VIP in case
controller can't ping public gateway.

Closes-bug: 1370510
Change-Id: Ibf4fedee536ac9eb106206060b58a6039558ef85

commit_message:
Pass ipa-driver-name to agent ramdisk

This commit adds the change to pass ipa-driver-name to
agent ramdisk.  This enables agent ramdisk to do
vendor-passthru lookup on the actual driver instead of
the default 'agent_ipmitool' driver.

Change-Id: I750097dc24e11b44d4ed6d7c314cb8fb470dfcb0
Closes-bug: #1371505

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-18 08:53:14.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/ssh.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Revert "Search line with awk itself and avoid grep""

This commit was causing all tripleo ironic CI jobs to fail, this is
because every time we change a ssh string we need to first whitelist
it in the TripleO CI. Now the TripleO environment is ajusted and this
patch can be merged again.

The fix for the TripleO CI: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/120799/

Co-Authored-By: Motohiro OTSUKA <ootsuka@mxs.nes.nec.co.jp>
Change-Id: I60936ac36f4aa3810679c9f2420a29ae072dfb8a
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Revert "Search line with awk itself and avoid grep""

This commit was causing all tripleo ironic CI jobs to fail, this is
because every time we change a ssh string we need to first whitelist
it in the TripleO CI. Now the TripleO environment is ajusted and this
patch can be merged again.

The fix for the TripleO CI: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/120799/

Co-Authored-By: Motohiro OTSUKA <ootsuka@mxs.nes.nec.co.jp>
Change-Id: I60936ac36f4aa3810679c9f2420a29ae072dfb8a

subject: Recover from errors while deleting image segments
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-08-19 18:12:00.000000000', 'files': ['glance/store/swift.py', 'glance/tests/unit/test_swift_store.py'], 'message': "Recover from errors while deleting image segments

When Glance attempts to delete an image, which is stored as a
segmented object, if an error occurs while deleting one of the
segments, delete operation fails while leaving behind rest of
the segments.

This patch enables Glance to recover from one or more errors during
segment deletion and proceed with deleting other segments. However,
this patch doesn't do anything with the failed segments themselves.
With this patch it'd be possible that even after an image is
deleted, certain chunks are left behind in the store.

Change-Id: I2e36b2b70102ed86c6883dd938c05447c2f0812f
Closes-Bug: 1256364
"}]
commit_message:
Recover from errors while deleting image segments

When Glance attempts to delete an image, which is stored as a
segmented object, if an error occurs while deleting one of the
segments, delete operation fails while leaving behind rest of
the segments.

This patch enables Glance to recover from one or more errors during
segment deletion and proceed with deleting other segments. However,
this patch doesn't do anything with the failed segments themselves.
With this patch it'd be possible that even after an image is
deleted, certain chunks are left behind in the store.

Change-Id: I2e36b2b70102ed86c6883dd938c05447c2f0812f
Closes-Bug: 1256364

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-09-16 01:44:47.000000000', 'files': ['reference/extra-atcs'], 'message': "Add Juno Compute co-authored-by authors to extra-atcs.

As discussed on our mailing list, I'd like to treat juno co-authors
for Compute ATCs. This is the simplest way to achieve that.

I have been asked to verify the foundation membership status of the
various people proposed in this patch. There is a comment per
person which does that. If the person has a commit _ever_ in an
incubated or graduated repository, then I consider them to be a
foundation member. For those authors where that is not true I have
hand verified their foundation profile id.

I have also been asked to _not_ generate this for other programs,
so I have stopped doing that and gone back to just doing Compute.

Change-Id: I687b59e037593499adcb112e2bf348afc5f2fb7d

commit_message:
Add Juno Compute co-authored-by authors to extra-atcs.

As discussed on our mailing list, I'd like to treat juno co-authors
for Compute ATCs. This is the simplest way to achieve that.

I have been asked to verify the foundation membership status of the
various people proposed in this patch. There is a comment per
person which does that. If the person has a commit _ever_ in an
incubated or graduated repository, then I consider them to be a
foundation member. For those authors where that is not true I have
hand verified their foundation profile id.

I have also been asked to _not_ generate this for other programs,
so I have stopped doing that and gone back to just doing Compute.
Other PTLs can do this for their programs if they desire, using
the script I will propose in a separate change.

Change-Id: I687b59e037593499adcb112e2bf348afc5f2fb7d

commit_message:
Delete image when backup operation failed on snapshot step

when we snapshot an instance, we will use @delete_image_on_error to
delete any failed snapshot, however, the image will not be removed
by backup code flow, it will be an issue if too many backup failed
at last ,all useful image will be removed and we have only 'error'
image left in host

Change-Id: Ib527ade86aef52a8445b57fa03fed434578c4204
Closes-Bug: #1288574
(cherry picked from commit 3824051b1e5618388a17c88867a3037397bc96b7)

rather than make an explicit call to conductor.

Also, we don't need the resource tracker update call
that happens in _instance_update since we just allocated
the network and there isn't anything being tracked for
that operation (yet, there is the SR-IOV stuff coming).

Change-Id: I8b99cd07bda7c91995b53f6ded12b05130e47a95
"}]
commit_message:
Remove _instance_update call in _allocate_network_async

We already have an instance object so just call save()
rather than make an explicit call to conductor.

Also, we don't need the resource tracker update call
that happens in _instance_update since we just allocated
the network and there isn't anything being tracked for
that operation (yet, there is the SR-IOV stuff coming).

Part of blueprint compute-manager-objects-juno

Change-Id: I8b99cd07bda7c91995b53f6ded12b05130e47a95

commit_message:
Retry running queries when not in a transaction

Use the existing wrap mechanism applied to Query class to retry running
queries when not in a transaction and autocommit is on.
Provides some tolerance for mysql restart for running queries

Fixes bug 1040694

Change-Id: I1793a801bc09cef79514b5be293c6309125b09c1

subject: Robust detection for postgresql connection errors
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-05-08 15:58:33.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/db/sqlalchemy/test_sqlalchemy.py', 'openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/session.py'], 'message': 'Robust detection for postgresql connection errors

In most cases, when the database is failing over to a new node,
engine.dialect.is_disconnected() returns True. However in some
cases it returns False and the exception string is "unknown error".
In those cases we can however query the closed attribute on the
db_connection that is set to True at that point.

Change-Id: I64ef17f451780c622e1cfd257acf74e2e11e8b62
Closes-Bug: #1306668
'}]
commit_message:
Robust detection for postgresql connection errors

In most cases, when the database is failing over to a new node,
engine.dialect.is_disconnected() returns True. However in some
cases it returns False and the exception string is "unknown error".
In those cases we can however query the closed attribute on the
db_connection that is set to True at that point.

Change-Id: I64ef17f451780c622e1cfd257acf74e2e11e8b62
Closes-Bug: #1306668

commit_message:
[Vanilla] Increased security of temporary files for db

* changed location of files from /tmp to ~
* added code to remove file after use
* refactored code to have all actions with files in one place

Things that can be improved
* remove code duplication around db actions

Change-Id: I44657ae9331d4369e667c5dbc0d0f383b9b49cd5

This fix makes the updating of the _mounted_shares list in

commit_message:
Don't clear _mounted_shares list in remoteFS while updating

This fix makes the updating of the _mounted_shares list in
remoteFS more of an atomic operation.  Previously this list
would be cleared, then rebuilt.  That allowed a race
condition where operations that took place during this
update would have a list of 0 shares to work with.

Closes-Bug: #1366083
cherry-picked from commit 9cc9cf111ef8a0265df5323fecaed12b0dabe312

Change-Id: I740d8f1b87db911242326a38ff398b81c5974cea

commit_message:
Set LDAP certificate trust options for LDAPS and TLS

We currently only set the LDAP library certificate trust options
when TLS is being used (via startTLS).  If regular LDAPS is being
used, the certificate trust options that are defined in Keystone's
configuration file are never actually set.

This patch sets the certificate trust options for both LDAPS and
TLS cases.

Closes-bug: #1209343
Change-Id: Ieb94b732f623695920feb34995bb863175ddf27a

commit_message:
Upgrade django_openstack_auth to version 1.1.7 for Horizon

django_openstack_auth added a TOKEN_TIMEOUT_MARGIN required to check token
expiration minus a time margin in seconds, and the django.contrib.auth.views
login and logout views take usefull parameters which where dropped by the
previous openstack_auth.views methods and are required to fix bug 1308918
Also a major bug 1324948 has been fixed where keystone urls where rewritten
if "v3" or "v2.0" was found in the hostname.

Change-Id: Id0bee6c6baf70cb0f230f22b06cf013ae0a6f884
Partial-bug: #1308918

commit_message:
Device Size field now pre-fills with appropriate value

The Device Size field in the Create Instance workflow will now pre-fill
with a value equal to the largest of either the min_disk value of the
selected image or the total_disk value of the selected flavor - provided
that the larger value is >= 1.

Change-Id: I2f9cb3e956fe374609503b8c955f98a4efe3a456
Closes-Bug: 1328911

commit_message:
Fix reconnect race condition with RabbitMQ cluster

Retry declaring Queue if it fail to workaround the race condition
that may happen when both Neutron and RabbitMQ cluster are trying
to create and delete (Respectively) Queues and Exchanges that have
auto-delete flag set.

Change-Id: I3c267f0f67d856e6bfb225b05ea8e50681d72df0
Closes-Bug: #1318721

subject: Switch logging debug on by default
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-03 01:53:27.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/log.py'], 'message': "Switch logging debug on by default

Our defaults should match what our users use and we've had fairly
comprehensive feedback that operators - particularly large ones - use
debug logging to facilitate first-failure-analysis of faults.
Secondly, all devstack installs force debug to True, (and we depend on
that in CI) - changing this to match how these environments are
deployed will allow us to run defaults in a wider set of environments.
In future when our logging is fixed up we may find that deployers no
longer want debug, and we can of course change our defaults then to
follow suite.

I'm told there are some particularly egregious modules that need to be
filtered for this to make sense - I'm going to request operator input
to get those into this patch before it lands.

Change-Id: I54a694e55bba80bf4818486246ab12ea132ee5bd
"}]
commit_message:
Switch logging debug on by default

Our defaults should match what our users use and we've had fairly
comprehensive feedback that operators - particularly large ones - use
debug logging to facilitate first-failure-analysis of faults.
Secondly, all devstack installs force debug to True, (and we depend on
that in CI) - changing this to match how these environments are
deployed will allow us to run defaults in a wider set of environments.
In future when our logging is fixed up we may find that deployers no
longer want debug, and we can of course change our defaults then to
follow suite.

I'm told there are some particularly egregious modules that need to be
filtered for this to make sense - I'm going to request operator input
to get those into this patch before it lands.

Change-Id: I54a694e55bba80bf4818486246ab12ea132ee5bd

the lock_path as lock file location folder is missing and
it make it's impossible to specify where to find the lock file.
This patch added the params.

Related-Bug: #1256306

commit_message:
Deletes timeutils.set_time_override

The set_time_override function in timeutils was written as a
helper function to mock utcnow for unittests before 'mock' was
generally used. Now that we have mock and fixture, we no longer
need to use it.

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 708, 'name': 'Yuriy Taraday', 'email': 'yorik.sar@gmail.com', 'username': 'yorik-sar'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 5293, 'name': 'Nikhil', 'email': 'SlickNik@gmail.com', 'username': 'slicknik'}, {'_account_id': 6601, 'name': 'James Carey', 'email': 'jecarey@yerac.com', 'username': 'jecarey'}, {'_account_id': 8041, 'name': 'Petr Blaho', 'email': 'pblaho@redhat.com', 'username': 'pblaho'}, {'_account_id': 9664, 'name': 'amrith', 'email': 'amrith.kumar@gmail.com', 'username': 'amrith'}, {'_account_id': 9749, 'name': 'Greg Lucas', 'email': 'greg@glucas.net', 'username': 'glucas'}, {'_account_id': 9800, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka'}, {'_account_id': 10215, 'name': 'Peter Stachowski', 'email': 'peter@tesora.com', 'username': 'peterstac'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2014-09-09 11:45:41.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_processutils.py', 'openstack/common/processutils.py'], 'message': "Handle a failure on communicate()

After much debugging of the subject bug, we've concluded that a
failure and an exception of OSError with EAGAIN from communicate()
indicates some monkey business. In the specific case that we're seeing
in Trove, it is because monkey patching didn't quite get done the way
it should.

In any event, retrying isn't the answer.  This change reverts an
earlier change that retried the communicate() call and instead hurls
the OSError exception back to the caller, if we are out of retries. A
test case to fake the communicate() failure has been amended to ensure
that we handle this in what we believe now to be the right way.

This change was merged in oslo.concurrency as Change-Id
Ie36d77eebb2c20124a61ff6029c3b97bfffb9427

Change-Id: I2450d2dc425a3d29eaba4d5ff9badc4a992a0ec8
Closes-Bug: #1347337
Related-Bug: #1365736
"}]
commit_message:
Handle a failure on communicate()

After much debugging of the subject bug, we've concluded that a
failure and an exception of OSError with EAGAIN from communicate()
indicates some monkey business. In the specific case that we're seeing
in Trove, it is because monkey patching didn't quite get done the way
it should.

In any event, retrying isn't the answer.  This change reverts an
earlier change that retried the communicate() call and instead hurls
the OSError exception back to the caller, if we are out of retries. A
test case to fake the communicate() failure has been amended to ensure
that we handle this in what we believe now to be the right way.

This change was merged in oslo.concurrency as Change-Id
Ie36d77eebb2c20124a61ff6029c3b97bfffb9427

Change-Id: I2450d2dc425a3d29eaba4d5ff9badc4a992a0ec8
Closes-Bug: #1347337
Related-Bug: #1365736

commit_message:
Remove 'detail' dimension, fix a couple bugs

The 'detail' dimension in http_check is not actually an appropriate
dimension since it does not contain data which _identifies_ a metric.
This data is valuable, though, and will be captured and made available
in a future enhancement.

Bug fixes:
- Fix unix.py crash on EFI mountpoints which return 0 available inodes
- Rename 'service_name' to 'name' in nagios_wrapper for ServicesCheck
  compatibility
- Update nagios_wrapper YAML example for naming convention

Change-Id: I44877a856fac84f54ca764a79e75ace9f90d9302

subject: Add _wrap_db_error support for postgresql
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-07-18 13:24:43.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/db/sqlalchemy/test_sqlalchemy.py', 'openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/session.py'], 'message': 'Add _wrap_db_error support for postgresql

The original "_wrap_db_error" function is only available for mysql.
We need to add support for postgresql.

The deadlock exception thrown from postgresql is TransactionRollbackError,
it's not the same with "OperationalError" thrown from mysql,
and isn't included in sqlalchemy. So, the base exception need to be
catched.

Change-Id: I439a4e0c431c9446ffabd1c93f11b8f509b1ebd7
Closes-Bug: #1270725
(cherry picked from commit 3a6a5b01a72e0e20787f3d6a47f6f0c0262dbbeb)
'}]
commit_message:
Add _wrap_db_error support for postgresql

The original "_wrap_db_error" function is only available for mysql.
We need to add support for postgresql.

The deadlock exception thrown from postgresql is TransactionRollbackError,
it's not the same with "OperationalError" thrown from mysql,
and isn't included in sqlalchemy. So, the base exception need to be
catched.

Change-Id: I439a4e0c431c9446ffabd1c93f11b8f509b1ebd7
Closes-Bug: #1270725
(cherry picked from commit 3a6a5b01a72e0e20787f3d6a47f6f0c0262dbbeb)

A flavor can be created or deleted at any time, no matter if
an instance references it or not. Since instances reference
the flavor by their 'flavor-id', which is not unique, you
can create, delete, and re-create the flavor using the same
flavor-id. This could cause issues with instance actions, e.g.

commit_message:
Prevent in-use flavors from being deleted

A flavor can be created or deleted at any time, no matter if
an instance references it or not. Since instances reference
the flavor by their 'flavor-id', which is not unique, you
can create, delete, and re-create the flavor using the same
flavor-id. This could cause issues with instance actions, e.g.
resize or rescue, because a re-created flavor with the same
flavor-id could have a different configuration. This patch
prevents a flavor from being deleted if it is in-use by an
instance.

Change-Id: I862d267bca41934f9150ffa4441ce0a24a61bc38
Closes-Bug: #1320754

revisions:

Decorating an sqlalchemy db api method with retry_on_deadlock will
result in an automatic retry when a DBDeadlock exception is encountered.

Cinder, Glance, and Nova all have a copy of this decorator.  Now it is
