Change-Id: If76b80fefa3a3fd7efce2433069af07efdb9fdfd
'}]
commit_message:
Add retry_on_deadlock decorator

Decorating an sqlalchemy db api method with retry_on_deadlock will
result in an automatic retry when a DBDeadlock exception is encountered.

Cinder, Glance, and Nova all have a copy of this decorator.  Now it is
needed by Heat.

Change-Id: If76b80fefa3a3fd7efce2433069af07efdb9fdfd

subject: Removes bogus negative create image compute
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-18 08:19:15.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/images/test_images_oneserver_negative.py'], 'message': "Removes bogus negative create image compute

Removes test_create_image_specify_multibyte_character_image_name
as it is not a valid test. It currently does not send an
invalid utf-8 sequence, but a valid unicode one. Also we can't actually
send an invalid utf-8 sequence via JSON as it is not possible to
encode an invalid UTF-8 sequence into a series of unicode characters
which is what JSON uses as strings. So its not possible for it
to fail this way. And we don't do XML testing for this type of test.

Change-Id: I39b5c017c8a173f8dd56a14c1bc7dc6952ac787d
Partially-Closes: 1006725
"}]
commit_message:
Removes bogus negative create image compute

Removes test_create_image_specify_multibyte_character_image_name
as it is not a valid test. It currently does not send an
invalid utf-8 sequence, but a valid unicode one. Also we can't actually
send an invalid utf-8 sequence via JSON as it is not possible to
encode an invalid UTF-8 sequence into a series of unicode characters
which is what JSON uses as strings. So its not possible for it
to fail this way. And we don't do XML testing for this type of test.

Change-Id: I39b5c017c8a173f8dd56a14c1bc7dc6952ac787d
Partially-Closes: 1006725

commit_message:
fix memory leak for _safe_log

In _safe_log it use recursive closure. The gc can not free stack for
those recursive closure for cycle-reference. So cut down the cycle
to fix it.

Resolved Bug #1365892

Change-Id: Ic520d05ac1f70633348b1bd4f0f4c3cab991f668

commit_message:
Delete the token and endpoint on expiry of token of client

This change will guarantee that clients using this module will
renew the session on token expiry. Currently this fact causes
the issues with Ceilometer client and its usage in the
ceilometer-alarm-evaluator.

Co-Authored-By: vaibhav_kale <vaibhav_kale@persistent.co.in> 
Related-Bug: #1357343
Change-Id: I10b8c4c9d6aa4ce74028e91cc5e8a85e47e6953b

subject: Fixup Fixtures Use in db test classes.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-11 21:45:12.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/test_base.py'], 'message': "Fixup Fixtures Use in db test classes.

With Fixture objects and test cases it is important to upcall first
rather than later to allow base classes to configure their internal
test tracking state. Failing to do so allows bugs like this one to
occur - when failure occurs early, the state required to gather
environmental details about the failure is not prepared, and the
test machinery will raise secondary exceptions as it tries to do that.

This may even obscure the original error.

I've taken a fairly minimal approach here - I think it would be
possible and likely even desirable to get rid of the test classes
altogether - this module appears to have very little, if any, actual
test code - its all glue for managing the test database connections.
However I know zzzeek is working on a fairly large reorg in this
area and I don't want to conceptually clash with that - we can do
further cleanups later.

Change-Id: Ic9f24aa2352d097a10be8420b701fa9f588b21b0
Closes-Bug: #1330763
"}]
commit_message:
Fixup Fixtures Use in db test classes.

With Fixture objects and test cases it is important to upcall first
rather than later to allow base classes to configure their internal
test tracking state. Failing to do so allows bugs like this one to
occur - when failure occurs early, the state required to gather
environmental details about the failure is not prepared, and the
test machinery will raise secondary exceptions as it tries to do that.

This may even obscure the original error.

I've taken a fairly minimal approach here - I think it would be
possible and likely even desirable to get rid of the test classes
altogether - this module appears to have very little, if any, actual
test code - its all glue for managing the test database connections.
However I know zzzeek is working on a fairly large reorg in this
area and I don't want to conceptually clash with that - we can do
further cleanups later.

Change-Id: Ic9f24aa2352d097a10be8420b701fa9f588b21b0
Closes-Bug: #1330763

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-09-15 06:18:15.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/plugin/resources.py', 'barbican/model/repositories.py', 'barbican/plugin/crypto/crypto.py', 'barbican/plugin/store_crypto.py', 'barbican/plugin/interface/secret_store.py', 'barbican/plugin/kmip_secret_store.py', 'barbican/tests/plugin/test_store_crypto.py', 'barbican/plugin/dogtag.py'], 'message': "Remove config parameter from secret_store.py interface

When the barbican.plugins.secret_store.py interface was added, the
existing HSM-style plugins were placed into an adapter module called
store_crypto.py. Since this module, unlike other secret-store
technologies such as Dogtag or KMIP requires access to lower level data
store resources such as KEKDatum, these resources were added to a
'context' parameter. Unfortunately all secret_store.py implementors had
to inherit this contract. Hence this CR removes that constraint, and
starts the process of moving towards singleton-based repository
instances.

Note as well that the secret_store.py module now has 100% unit test
coverage.

Change-Id: I7094beb4d593a6ac7a9de3cb818ac455f5c6ec1b
"}]
commit_message:
Remove config parameter from secret_store.py interface

When the barbican.plugins.secret_store.py interface was added, the
existing HSM-style plugins were placed into an adapter module called
store_crypto.py. Since this module, unlike other secret-store
technologies such as Dogtag or KMIP requires access to lower level data
store resources such as KEKDatum, these resources were added to a
'context' parameter. Unfortunately all secret_store.py implementors had
to inherit this contract. Hence this CR removes that constraint, and
starts the process of moving towards singleton-based repository
instances.

Note as well that the secret_store.py module now has 100% unit test
coverage.

Change-Id: I7094beb4d593a6ac7a9de3cb818ac455f5c6ec1b

revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2014-09-12 20:51:39.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_processutils.py', 'openstack/common/processutils.py'], 'message': "Log stdout, stderr and command on execute() error

It would help debugging considerably if a failure in execute()
generated a message (at a client specified logging level). Such a
message, generated by execute() would only occur if the user requested
it by specifying a parameter (log_errors), and execute() were to throw
an exception. As an example, this change would address the issue being
addressed in bug 1340124 for the Trove project only.

DocImpact: New parameter added to processutils.execute().  The
possible values of the log_errors parameter are 'all' or 'final'. The
default value of None implies no logging. If it is set to 'final',
stdout and stderr are logged on the final failure. If it is set to
'all', stdout and stderr are logged on every failure.

DocImpact:
Change-Id: If8180e042e1a05374ef705f5873cc0981243619f
Closes-Bug: #1342857
Suggested-By: Peter Stachowski <peter@tesora.com>
Reported-By: Ionuț Arțăriși <iartarisi@suse.cz>
"}]
commit_message:
Log stdout, stderr and command on execute() error

It would help debugging considerably if a failure in execute()
generated a message (at a client specified logging level). Such a
message, generated by execute() would only occur if the user requested
it by specifying a parameter (log_errors), and execute() were to throw
an exception. As an example, this change would address the issue being
addressed in bug 1340124 for the Trove project only.

DocImpact: New parameter added to processutils.execute().  The
possible values of the log_errors parameter are 'all' or 'final'. The
default value of None implies no logging. If it is set to 'final',
stdout and stderr are logged on the final failure. If it is set to
'all', stdout and stderr are logged on every failure.

DocImpact:
Change-Id: If8180e042e1a05374ef705f5873cc0981243619f
Closes-Bug: #1342857
Suggested-By: Peter Stachowski <peter@tesora.com>
Reported-By: Ionuț Arțăriși <iartarisi@suse.cz>

subject: Cleanup and adding timing to lockutils logging
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-09-16 20:35:15.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/lockutils.py'], 'message': 'Cleanup and adding timing to lockutils logging

* Cleanup lockutils logging by showing lock name and function in same
line.  The enables easier parsing of information related to lock
acquisition from logs.

* Logs time a thread spent waiting on locks, as well as time spent
holding locks.  This will make it easier to debug suboptimal locking.

Change-Id: I1bc8d27eb03b43f79954a425d6bdc92ede85b0d0
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup and adding timing to lockutils logging

* Cleanup lockutils logging by showing lock name and function in same
line.  The enables easier parsing of information related to lock
acquisition from logs.

* Logs time a thread spent waiting on locks, as well as time spent
holding locks.  This will make it easier to debug suboptimal locking.

Change-Id: I1bc8d27eb03b43f79954a425d6bdc92ede85b0d0

commit_message:
Making action controller able to handler multiple actions

* Added action service similar to workflow service
* Added ActionListSpec to represent a top level action list
* Changed action controller to call action service properly
* Added required unit tests
* Other minor changes

commit_message:
Update stdlib dependency to 4.x

ironic's dependency on stdlib 2.3.0 is out of sync with the other
openstack modules. This is a problem because it is not possible to
install this module alongside the other openstack modules because of the
dependency conflicts. This patch fixes the issue by updating the
depenency on stdlib to 4.x. The stdlib functions currently in use in
ironic have carried on through 4.x.

Change-Id: I8d8f11049587b0d1e5a66914224d7ed922e51c4d

ironic.conductor.utils.node_power_action() catches any Exceptions but
raises IronicExceptions instead.

Drivers that handled exceptions from node_power_action() now

commit_message:
Raise IronicExceptions in node_power_action()

ironic.conductor.utils.node_power_action() catches any Exceptions but
raises IronicExceptions instead.

Drivers that handled exceptions from node_power_action() now
catch IronicExceptions instead of Exceptions.

Change-Id: I592f09b953355cf02083a0303a3204de247e4b46
Partial-Bug: #1267693

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-17 05:57:58.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/firewall.py'], 'message': 'Add missing methods for firewall driver

Commit If19be8579ca734a899cdd673c919eee8165aaa0e introduced an enhanced
rpc to update securitygroup info in securitygroups_rpc.py. But class
SecurityGroupAgentRpcCallbackMixin is inherited by all neutron agents
which some adopt their own firewall driver which does not have below
methods defined such as HyperVSecurityGroupsDriver. When those agents
start, it will raise AttributeError for these methods. So add them into
top firewall driver class.

update_security_group_rules
update_security_group_members

Closes-Bug: #1370342
Change-Id: I464cd141abea92b7d474ed428389540ac3d29ff9
'}]
commit_message:
Add missing methods for firewall driver

Commit If19be8579ca734a899cdd673c919eee8165aaa0e introduced an enhanced
rpc to update securitygroup info in securitygroups_rpc.py. But class
SecurityGroupAgentRpcCallbackMixin is inherited by all neutron agents
which some adopt their own firewall driver which does not have below
methods defined such as HyperVSecurityGroupsDriver. When those agents
start, it will raise AttributeError for these methods. So add them into
top firewall driver class.

update_security_group_rules
update_security_group_members

Closes-Bug: #1370342
Change-Id: I464cd141abea92b7d474ed428389540ac3d29ff9

commit_message:
Fix metadata constriant for Common

A patch went in that needed attributes in Common and the image
metadata was change to ~> 10.0.1 which worked until Common
was recently bumped to 10.1.  The metadata for Common should have had
a minor version bump, not a patch bump for the new attributes.

Change-Id: Ie46a83ec7b59cb1895978296628e857302c290a8
Closes-Bug: #1373008

Change-Id: I20e2e4a672fcd124ba3e64ec9728d184c6ed0c22

commit_message:
Enable the neutron dhcp and l3 agents

These need to be enabled in order for the upstart service to be allowed
to start, they are controlled by os-svc-enable-upstart as
OS_SVC_ENABLE_CONTROL is set in their upstart configs.

Change-Id: I20e2e4a672fcd124ba3e64ec9728d184c6ed0c22

commit_message:
Plugin/DB additions for version 2 of LBaaS API

Added alembic migrations, models, db methods and plugin methods.
Added DEFERRED status for entities not linked to a load balancer.
Added to_dict method in BaseNeutron model.
Sql Alchemy models in its own module.
Plugin database methods are accessed by composition through the plugin.
Added data models to convert sql alchemy models before passing to driver.

Partially-implements: blueprint lbaas-api-and-objmodel-improvement

Change-Id: Iaec2c2315ae54418b341eb31e6b3ff53b02ca9d7
Co-authored-by: Brandon Logan <brandon.logan@rackspace.com>
Co-authored-by: Vijayendra Bhamidipati <vbhamidipati@paypal.com>
Co-authored-by: Craig Tracey <Craig.Tracey@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-06 02:11:32.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/imagebackend.py'], 'message': "Fix instance boot when Ceph is used for ephemeral storage

is_block_dev attribute was mistakenly set to True for RBD images
(we don't actually map RBD images to block devices in the *host*
system, but only in *guests*, so as far as the host system is
concerned an RBD image must not be treated like a system block
device). This led to a situation when mkfs was called for a non
existing file and failed when trying to create an ephemeral fs.

Closes-Bug: #1362221

Change-Id: I54c0d117a53bb61f278b2e137bd29a595548f5a1
(cherry picked from commit e9eb1d69bf75c22b0ad4b50e4892a5644c78cf68)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix instance boot when Ceph is used for ephemeral storage

is_block_dev attribute was mistakenly set to True for RBD images
(we don't actually map RBD images to block devices in the *host*
system, but only in *guests*, so as far as the host system is
concerned an RBD image must not be treated like a system block
device). This led to a situation when mkfs was called for a non
existing file and failed when trying to create an ephemeral fs.

Closes-Bug: #1362221

Change-Id: I54c0d117a53bb61f278b2e137bd29a595548f5a1
(cherry picked from commit e9eb1d69bf75c22b0ad4b50e4892a5644c78cf68)

Related devstack change: Ie4bb075310a61a0873c9e56e4974600dbb4794a1

Change-Id: I0dc18d069a6a9c27ec1ae711c8746c6444d514da
'}]
commit_message:
Limit number of API workers used

Environments with large numbers of CPUs will create a large
number of workers which can have an unnecessarily large
impact on memory usage, particular where you know how many
workers are needed.

Related devstack change: Ie4bb075310a61a0873c9e56e4974600dbb4794a1

Change-Id: I0dc18d069a6a9c27ec1ae711c8746c6444d514da

commit_message:
Remove XenAPI driver

The XenAPI driver does not have known users and does not meet
the minimum requirements for Cinder drivers.

This patch removes the driver from the tree.

Closes-bug: 1372836

Change-Id: I2123b2d52180bbdffe90c458f115c67f50dfd5e9

subject: Do not use the context parameter on refresh()
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1926, 'name': 'Derek Higgins', 'email': 'derekh@redhat.com', 'username': 'derekh'}, {'_account_id': 6618, 'name': 'Ruby Loo', 'email': 'opensrloo@gmail.com', 'username': 'rloo'}, {'_account_id': 6773, 'name': 'Lucas Alvares Gomes', 'email': 'lucasagomes@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucasagomes'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 12081, 'name': 'IBM xCAT CI', 'email': 'xcat@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm-xcat-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-09-23 12:59:20.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/utils.py', 'ironic/objects/conductor.py', 'ironic/tests/objects/test_objects.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/agent.py', 'ironic/tests/drivers/test_pxe.py', 'ironic/objects/node.py', 'ironic/tests/conductor/test_manager.py', 'ironic/conductor/manager.py', 'ironic/tests/api/v1/test_ports.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/iscsi_deploy.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/ilo/deploy.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/pxe.py', 'ironic/objects/chassis.py', 'ironic/conductor/utils.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/seamicro.py', 'ironic/objects/port.py', 'ironic/tests/drivers/ilo/test_deploy.py', 'ironic/tests/conductor/test_conductor_utils.py'], 'message': "Do not use the context parameter on refresh()

Now all RPC objects already have a context embedded within them so we
can ignore the context parameter on the refresh() method (it was the
last method using this parameter). This patch also:

* Update the Docstrings from the @remotable methods to let the user know
  that the context parameter is not being used. The @remotable decorator
  still requires that the method it's decorating have a context as it's
  first argument, but that's going to change in the future.

* All code and tests were updated to not pass the context to refresh(),
  save() and destroy() methods.

Closes-Bug: #1314732
Change-Id: Ibb338b909d99862ae048d605e66b8831d8c2128d
"}]
commit_message:
Do not use the context parameter on refresh()

Now all RPC objects already have a context embedded within them so we
can ignore the context parameter on the refresh() method (it was the
last method using this parameter). This patch also:

* Update the Docstrings from the @remotable methods to let the user know
  that the context parameter is not being used. The @remotable decorator
  still requires that the method it's decorating have a context as it's
  first argument, but that's going to change in the future.

* All code and tests were updated to not pass the context to refresh(),
  save() and destroy() methods.

Closes-Bug: #1314732
Change-Id: Ibb338b909d99862ae048d605e66b8831d8c2128d

commit_message:
Always split template names on forward slash

Template names in Django always use forward slash, even on Windows,
so to parse them properly, split on forward slash instead of
os.path.sep which is '\\' on Windows.

Change-Id: Ib72b379397f014aa1e4557fed02cbac5d931b84e
Closes-Bug: #1371610
Co-Authored-By: Timur Sufiev <tsufiev@mirantis.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-09-16 16:31:01.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/manager.py', 'tempest/scenario/test_network_basic_ops.py', 'tempest/scenario/test_network_advanced_server_ops.py', 'tempest/scenario/test_security_groups_basic_ops.py'], 'message': 'Fix scenarios not passing down specific network

Nova v2 api expects nics in specific networks to be passed
down in an array of "networks". nics is used in novaclient
but converted to networks in
python-novaclient/tree/novaclient/v1_1/servers.py#n520

Apply the conversion to the parameters to make the check

Change-Id: Ic0b87377c5878e240a0fbcc6549023c828dd97ab
'}]
commit_message:
Fix scenarios not passing down specific network

Nova v2 api expects nics in specific networks to be passed
down in an array of "networks". nics is used in novaclient
but converted to networks in
python-novaclient/tree/novaclient/v1_1/servers.py#n520

Apply the conversion to the parameters to make the check
pass in case where there would be multiple networks
matching the requirements. Also remove a case where scenario
manager forced in the wrong network into the tests.

Closes-Bug: #1368834
Change-Id: Ic0b87377c5878e240a0fbcc6549023c828dd97ab

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4395, 'name': 'Aaron Rosen', 'email': 'aaronorosen@gmail.com', 'username': 'arosen'}, {'_account_id': 8215, 'name': 'Tim Hinrichs', 'email': 'timothy.l.hinrichs@gmail.com', 'username': 'thinrich'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9253, 'name': 'Peter Balland', 'email': 'peter@balland.net', 'username': 'peter_balland'}, {'_account_id': 11174, 'name': 'Harrison Kelly', 'email': 'harrison.kelly@plexxi.com', 'username': 'harrison.kelly'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2014-09-16 19:16:58.000000000', 'files': ['congress/dse/tests/test_dse.py', 'congress/datasources/tests/unit/test_neutron_driver.py', 'congress/dse/d6message.py', 'congress/harness.py', 'congress/dse/d6cage.py', 'congress/dse/amqprouter.py', 'congress/dse/deepsix.py', 'congress/dse/dataobj.py', 'congress/datasources/tests/unit/test_nova_driver.py'], 'message': "Changed DSE to use eventlets rather than threads

Implements: blueprint dse

The current problem is that the DSE uses threads rather than
eventlets. This problem has two main issues that make it a
problem. First, the rest of Congress uses eventlets instead
of threads. The DSE should follow what the rest of Congress
uses and also use eventlets. The fix for that problem is to
make the DSE use eventlets rather than threads. The second
problem is that threads are not very scalable in Python and
there is a lack of performance because of Python's GIL, which
only allows one thread to execute at a time. That is not
useful in the situation of the DSE since we want multiple
lines of code to execute at a time because multiple services
are running at once. The fix for that problem is also to
switch the DSE to using eventlets rather than threads.

The fix for these two problems, which this change does, is to
change the DSE to use eventlets rather than threads. Instead of
the d6service class inheriting from threading.Thread, it now
inherits from eventlet.greenthread.GreenThread, which makes d6service
now an eventlet rather than a thread. This will fix scalability
issues as I mentioned above, and also make the DSE use eventlets
like the rest of Congress does.

Changed the implementation so that the spawning of the green
threads is hidden from the user and they can initialize a
service by just using: Service() instead of having to use
deepsix.SpawnService(Service).

Change-Id: Ib9c62e3942f1127bb58b398a98f2844bf7669869
"}]
commit_message:
Changed DSE to use eventlets rather than threads

Implements: blueprint dse

The current problem is that the DSE uses threads rather than
eventlets. This problem has two main issues that make it a
problem. First, the rest of Congress uses eventlets instead
of threads. The DSE should follow what the rest of Congress
uses and also use eventlets. The fix for that problem is to
make the DSE use eventlets rather than threads. The second
problem is that threads are not very scalable in Python and
there is a lack of performance because of Python's GIL, which
only allows one thread to execute at a time. That is not
useful in the situation of the DSE since we want multiple
lines of code to execute at a time because multiple services
are running at once. The fix for that problem is also to
switch the DSE to using eventlets rather than threads.

The fix for these two problems, which this change does, is to
change the DSE to use eventlets rather than threads. Instead of
the d6service class inheriting from threading.Thread, it now
inherits from eventlet.greenthread.GreenThread, which makes d6service
now an eventlet rather than a thread. This will fix scalability
issues as I mentioned above, and also make the DSE use eventlets
like the rest of Congress does.

Changed the implementation so that the spawning of the green
threads is hidden from the user and they can initialize a
service by just using: Service() instead of having to use
deepsix.SpawnService(Service).

Change-Id: Ib9c62e3942f1127bb58b398a98f2844bf7669869

commit_message:
VMware: Store vCenter passwords in keystone credential store

This blueprint proposes an alternative way of storing vCenter user names and
passwords for OpenStack administrators that are leery of keeping them within
nova.conf as plain text.

blueprint vmware-encrypt-vcenter-passwords

Change-Id: If8b56491e3eae13b619bb795e3f7ce2f3864f96e

given the state of Zabbix.

to run MOSt and added the same note as is in the Release Notes.

marked Zabbix as experimental.

running Fuel Master, not before it is installed.

about Mirantis OpenStack Express

commit_message:

commit_message:
Floating ip does not have an id

1) Floating ip does not have an id, it uses floating_ip_address
   as the key.
2) There is no attribute that is similar to a name.
3) Set resource_name for person friendly print.

Change-Id: I9e0d21dcf446ad19fe416a868e3ddfa804b99f36

subject: Adding SSL/TLS protocol version checks
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-09-23 14:48:13.000000000', 'files': ['examples/ssl-insecure-version.py', '.gitignore', 'bandit/context.py', 'plugins/insecure_ssl_tls.py', 'bandit.yaml'], 'message': 'Adding SSL/TLS protocol version checks

Bandit can now check for insecure SSL/TLS versions, bad versions
are defined in the config file. By default:
 - SSLv2 is bad
 - SSLv23 is bad
 - SSLv3 is bad
 - TLSv1 is bad

This check works with ssl and pyOpenSSL modules.
A second check will also catch default use of ssl.wrap_socket as
this will use SSLv23 if no option is given. This is an INFO level
check.

Change-Id: I5ff8ea7038eed41b09e4d0ebfcb59bfd7fd4c894
'}]
commit_message:
Adding SSL/TLS protocol version checks

Bandit can now check for insecure SSL/TLS versions, bad versions
are defined in the config file. By default:
 - SSLv2 is bad
 - SSLv23 is bad
 - SSLv3 is bad
 - TLSv1 is bad

This check works with ssl and pyOpenSSL modules.
A second check will also catch default use of ssl.wrap_socket as
this will use SSLv23 if no option is given. This is an INFO level
check.

Change-Id: I5ff8ea7038eed41b09e4d0ebfcb59bfd7fd4c894

commit_message:
Ceilometer -- configure vCenter support

Document how to manually configure Ceilometer to report
vCenter metering information.
This could be written up just as a work-around to the bug
but customers are requesting this information so I put the
instructions in the OpsGuide.

An entry in "Known Issues" links to the Ops Guide section.
